alert.note: Alert for Central Tularosa Basin; Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet; Southern Tularosa Basin; West Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 5:01PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorm outflow winds will impact portions of northwestern Otero through 630 PM MDT... At 458 PM MDT, weather observations reported a strong thunderstorm winds of 30 to 50 mph moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Weather observations. IMPACT...Gusty winds will produce dense blowing dust and lower visibilities and could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Tularosa, White Sands National Monument, Three Rivers, Alamogordo, Bent, Burro Flats, La Luz, Holloman Air Force Base, Boles Acres, Oliver Lee State Park and Three Rivers Petroglyph Site. This includes the following highways... Highway 70 in New Mexico between mile markers 191 and 212. Highway 54 in New Mexico between mile markers 52 and 100. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Tularosa Basin; Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet; Southern Tularosa Basin; West Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet
